title: vivo Pad5 Pro, Pad SE, and Watch 5 detailed ahead of launch
description: We already know that the vivo X200 Ultra and X200s are launching later this month but they won’t be the only new devices announced at the launch event. The brand also detailed the upcoming vivo Pad5 Pro and Pad SE tablets as well as the all-new vivo Watch 5. All three devices are now available for pre-order in China, while their official launch date is yet to be confirmed. Pad5 Pro is the brand’s next generation flagship Android tablet, coming in as the successor to last year’s Pad3 Pro. It will feature a 13-inch LCD with 3.1K resolution and a 144Hz refresh rate and will be equipped...
excerpt: All three are set to debut alongside the vivo X200 Ultra and X200s. We already know that the vivo X200 Ultra and X200s are launching later this month but...
text: We already know that the vivo X200 Ultra and X200s are launching later this month but they won’t be the only new devices announced at the launch event. The brand also detailed the upcoming vivo Pad5 Pro and Pad SE tablets as well as the all-new vivo Watch 5. All three devices are now available for pre-order in China, while their official launch date is yet to be confirmed. Pad5 Pro is the brand’s next generation flagship Android tablet, coming in as the successor to last year’s Pad3 Pro. It will feature a 13-inch LCD with 3.1K resolution and a 144Hz refresh rate and will be equipped with MediaTek’s upcoming Dimensity 9400+ chipset. The device will be available with 8/12GB RAM and up to 512GB storage and it will feature a 12,000 mAh battery with 66W fast charging. Pad SE will be a more affordable entry with a 12.5-inch LCD, 6/8GB RAM and up to 256GB storage. The device will be available in Blue, Titanium, and Dark Gray colors and will feature 15W wired charging. Watch 5 is set to feature the maker’s custom-built BlueOS operating system. It will feature a round AMOLED display just like the vivo Watch 3 with a digital crown element on the right-hand side. Watch 5 will be available in Star Black, Moonlight White, and Stainless Steel Belt colors. Source (in Chinese)
html:
We already know that the vivo X200 Ultra and X200s are launching later this month but they won’t be the only new devices announced at the launch event. The brand also detailed the upcoming vivo Pad5 Pro and Pad SE tablets as well as the all-new vivo Watch 5. All three devices are now available for pre-order in China, while their official launch date is yet to be confirmed.

Pad5 Pro is the brand’s next generation flagship Android tablet, coming in as the successor to last year’s Pad3 Pro. It will feature a 13-inch LCD with 3.1K resolution and a 144Hz refresh rate and will be equipped with MediaTek’s upcoming Dimensity 9400+ chipset. The device will be available with 8/12GB RAM and up to 512GB storage and it will feature a 12,000 mAh battery with 66W fast charging.

Pad SE will be a more affordable entry with a 12.5-inch LCD, 6/8GB RAM and up to 256GB storage. The device will be available in Blue, Titanium, and Dark Gray colors and will feature 15W wired charging.

Watch 5 is set to feature the maker’s custom-built BlueOS operating system. It will feature a round AMOLED display just like the vivo Watch 3 with a digital crown element on the right-hand side. Watch 5 will be available in Star Black, Moonlight White, and Stainless Steel Belt colors.

Source (in Chinese)
